duties_responsibilities.duty: Develop and maintain geospatial databases, including transit stops.
Analyze and interpret geospatial data to support transportation objectives.
Create maps and visualizations using GIS software.
Perform data quality checks and validation.
Prepare and analyze ridership performance, user characteristics, and trend analysis relative to GIS and physical features of transit services.
Prepare transit data reports in compliance with federal and state requirements.
Submit reporting data to transit databases and associations as directed.

education_certification.credential: Bachelor’s degree in urban planning, geography, economics, computer science or related field, and at least two years of direct work experience in geographic information systems and geospatial analytics. A GIS Certificate is required. (Master’s preferred)
